title: our earth
text: We have some places</br>where ugliness rules,</br>but more places</br>where beauty rules</br></br>on this blue Earth
author: Taro Aizu

title: dreams
text: Dreams,</br>we become</br>humans by them,</br>and we should die</br>without them.
author: Jose Luis Vazquez

title: blue
text: We could fill the seas</br>with old stars’ dust,</br>heaven and seas</br>are the same</br>We will be lost in the blue.
author: Jose Luis Vazquez

title: Japan
text: One hundred years</br>two hundred years</br>the more time passes by,</br>the more beautiful it gets</br>a temple garden.
author: Taro Aizu

title: life
text: Life is never promised.</br>We pass through time</br>like leaves blowing in the wind –</br>Like dew evaporating in the sun.</br>Life is never promised.
author: Kanzen Sakura

title: mt. Fuji in spring
text: Mustard fields</br>at the foot of the mountain,</br>the summit of Mt. Fuji</br>still covered with snow</br>rises in the blue sky.
author: Taro Aizu

title: submissive
text: every word you speak.</br>the mere breath you exhail.</br>the glimmer in the look in your eyes.</br>so makes me weak at a moment like this.</br>just for a precious and tender kiss.
author: Robert Gillette

title: Mt. Fuji in summer
text: Barely reaching the summit,</br>I can easily see</br>the top of Mt. Fuji</br>rising still</br>over the sea of clouds.
author: Taro Aizu

title: Mt. Fuji in autumn
text: As the sun sets</br>behind far mountains,</br>appears a little by little</br>in the evening sky</br>a silhouette of Mt. Fuji.
author: Taro Aizu

title: Mt. Fuji in winter
text: The more I look at</br>white Mt. Fuji</br>in the blue sky</br>on a cold morning,</br>The more it cleanses my heart.
author: Taro Aizu
